intro: Ginoria americana, commonly known as the American ginoria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family, which includes geraniums and other related species. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
